00051 #ifndef SYSCALL_H
00052 #define SYSCALL_H
00053 
00054 #ifdef __cplusplus
00055 extern "C" {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #include <sys/types.h>
00059 #include <sys/time.h>
00060 
00061 #include "host.h"
00062 #include "misc.h"
00063 #include "machine.h"
00064 #include "thread.h"
00065 
00066 /*
00067  * This module implements the system call portion of the SimpleScalar
00068  * instruction set architecture.  The system call definitions are borrowed
00069  * from Ultrix.  All system calls are executed by the simulator (the host) on
00070  * behalf of the simulated program (the target). The basic procedure for
00071  * implementing a system call is as follows:
00072  *
00073  *      1) decode the system call (this is the enum in "syscode")
00074  *      2) copy system call inputs in target (simulated program) memory
00075  *         to host memory (simulator memory), note: the location and
00076  *         amount of memory to copy is system call specific
00077  *      3) the simulator performs the system call on behalf of the target prog
00078  *      4) copy system call results in host memory to target memory
00079  *      5) set result register to indicate the error status of the system call
00080  *
00081  * That's it...  If you encounter an unimplemented system call and would like
00082  * to add support for it, first locate the syscode and arguments for the system
00083  * call when it occurs (do this in the debugger) and then implement a proxy
00084  * procedure in syscall.c.
00085  *
00086  */
00087 
00088 
00089 /* syscall proxy handler, architect registers and memory are assumed to be
00090    precise when this function is called, register and memory are updated with
00091    the results of the sustem call */
00092 void
00093 sys_syscall(struct thread_t *core,      /* current cpu core */
00094             mem_access_fn mem_fn,       /* generic memory accessor */
00095             md_inst_t inst,             /* system call inst */
00096             int traceable);             /* traceable system call? */
00097 
00098 #ifdef __cplusplus
00099 }
00100 #endif 
00101 
00102 #endif /* SYSCALL_H */
